XDocker engine api methods¶

POST /removeUsername¶

Remove user

Example request

POST /removeUsername HTTP/1.1
{
    "token": "<token>"
}

Example response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Type: application/json
Server: nginx/1.1.19
Vary: Accept-Encoding

{
    "status": "Username removed successfully",
}
JSON Parameters:
 
  • token (string) – Authentication token
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – no error
POST /authenticate¶

Authenticate method

Example request

POST /authenticate HTTP/1.1
{
    "password": "test",
    "username": "test"
}

Example response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Type: application/json
Server: nginx/1.1.19
Vary: Accept-Encoding

{
    "status": "OK",
    "token": "<token>"
}
JSON Parameters:
 
  • username (string) – Username to authenticate
  • password (string) – Password for the user
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – no error
  • 404 Not Found – user does not exist
Response JSON Object:
 
  • token (string) – Token to use
POST /downloadKey¶

Download security key

Example request

POST /downloadKey HTTP/1.1
{
    "token": "<token>",
}

Example response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Type: application/json
Server: nginx/1.1.19
Vary: Accept-Encoding

{
    "status": "OK",
    "key": "<key>"
}
JSON Parameters:
 
  • token (string) – Authentication token
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – no error
  • 401 Unauthorized – not authorized
Response JSON Object:
 
  • key (string) – encrypted security key
POST /uploadKey¶

Upload security key

Example request

POST /uploadKey HTTP/1.1
{
    "token": "<token>",
    "key": "<key">,
    "cloudProvider": "amazon aws"
}

Example response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Type: application/json
Server: nginx/1.1.19
Vary: Accept-Encoding

{
    "status": "OK",
}
JSON Parameters:
 
  • token (string) – Authentication token
  • key (string) – Encrypted security key
  • cloudProvider (string) – cloud provider name
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – no error
  • 401 Unauthorized – not authorized
POST /register¶

Register method

Example request

POST /register HTTP/1.1
{
    "password": "test",
    "username": "test"
}

Example response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Type: application/json
Server: nginx/1.1.19
Vary: Accept-Encoding

{
    "status": "OK",
}
JSON Parameters:
 
  • username (string) – Username to register
  • password (string) – Password for the user
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – no error
  • 409 Conflict – user already exists
POST /instance¶

Perform action on instance

Example request

POST /instance HTTP/1.1
{
    "token": "<token>",
    "secretKey": "<api secret>",
    "apiKey": "<api key>",
    "instanceAction": "stop",
    "cloudProvider": "amazon aws"
}

Example response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Type: application/json
Server: nginx/1.1.19
Vary: Accept-Encoding

{
    "status": "OK",
    "job_id": "<job id>"
}
JSON Parameters:
 
  • token (string) – Authentication token
  • cloudProvider (string) – cloud provider name
  • apiKey (string) – Provider`s api key
  • secretKey (string) – Provider`s secret key
  • instanceAction (string) – Action to perform on instance(start, stop, restart, terminate)
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – no error
  • 401 Unauthorized – not authorized
Response JSON Object:
 
  • job_id (string) – Instance job id
POST /run¶

Run instance and deploy dockerhub package

Example request

POST /run HTTP/1.1
{
    "token": "<token>",
    "secretKey": "<api secret>",
    "packageName": "xdocker/securitymonkey",
    "dockerParams": {"ports": [443, 5000], "env": {}, "tag": "v1",
    "cmd": "/home/ubuntu/securitymonkey.sh"},
    "apiKey": "<api key>",
    "cloudProvider": "amazon aws"
}

Example response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Type: application/json
Server: nginx/1.1.19
Vary: Accept-Encoding

{
    "status": "OK",
    "job_id": "<job id>"
}
JSON Parameters:
 
  • token (string) – Authentication token
  • cloudProvider (string) – cloud provider name
  • apiKey (string) – Provider`s api key
  • instanceId (string) – Instance id to use for docker deployment(optional)
  • instanceRegion (string) – Region to create instance in (optional)
  • instanceAmi (string) – Ami to use for amazon instance(optional)
  • instanceType (string) – Type of the amazon instance (optional)
  • secretKey (string) – Provider`s secret key
  • packageName (string) – dockerhub package name
  • dockerParams (array) – package params for docker to start
  • dockerParams.ports (list) – list of ports
  • dockerParams.tag (string) – docker package tag
  • dockerParams.cmd (string) – docker command to run
  • dockerParams.env (array) – environment variables to pass to docker. Some values can be templated using brackets e.g. {host} converts to instance`s public dns
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – no error
  • 401 Unauthorized – not authorized
Response JSON Object:
 
  • job_id (string) – Deployment job id
POST /getDeploymentStatus/(job_id)¶

Get job status

Example request

POST /getDeploymentStatus/<job_id> HTTP/1.1
{
    "token": "<token>"
}

Example response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Type: application/json
Server: nginx/1.1.19
Vary: Accept-Encoding

{
    "status": "OK",
    "job_status": "Completed"
}
JSON Parameters:
 
  • token (string) – Authentication token
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – no error
  • 401 Unauthorized – not authorized
Response JSON Object:
 
  • job_status (string) – Job status
POST /getLog/(job_id)¶

Get log for job

Example request

POST /getLog/<job_id> HTTP/1.1
{
    "token": "<token>",
    "line_num": 10
}

Example response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Type: application/json
Server: nginx/1.1.19
Vary: Accept-Encoding

{
    "status": "OK",
    "log": "<log lines>"
}
JSON Parameters:
 
  • token (string) – Authentication token
  • line_num (integer) – Number of log lines to return(max 100, 10 default)
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – no error
  • 401 Unauthorized – not authorized
Response JSON Object:
 
  • log (string) – Last logs
